description: Clock King hatches a plan for his team of teenaged villains and their newest, deadliest member — the Teen Titans' own Ravager. But if it's to succeed, Clock King must first infiltrate the metahuman gladiator arena known as the Dark Side Club. Collecting TERROR TITANS #1-6.
name: TPB

description:
Solicitation

The chronicle of the Marvel Universe is filled with mind-blowing events - and, in this book, we begin recording them in the Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe-style! Covering events from all eras of Marvel history! The Earth-shaking (The Great Cataclysm! World War II! House of M/M-Day!), the universe-changing (Operation: Galactic Storm! The Annihilation War! War of Kings!) and other significant moments in the lives of your favorite Marvel characters (the Richards/Storm Wedding! Lost in Space Time! Armor Wars!). Plus many more! Featuring new art by Gus Vazquez!

Contents

Please do not tag the story arc pages with an appearance in this book as this is not a part of the story arc in question. Events and story arcs receiving entries in this handbook: Annihilation War, Armor Wars, Atlantis Attacks, Avengers/Defenders War, Battletide, Civil War, The Crossing, Dark Reign, Destiny War, Doom Supreme, Evolutionary War, Fall of the Hammer, Forces of Darkness, Forces of Light, The Great Cataclysm, Heroes Reborn/Heroes Return, House of M/M-Day, I.T. Plot, Inferno, Infinity Gauntlet, Kree-Skrull War, Lost in Space-Time, Maximum Carnage, Maximum Security, Mutant Massacre, Mys-Tech Wars, Odyssey, Operation: Galactic Storm, Richards-Storm Wedding, Secret Invasion, Secret Wars, Star Waaugh!, Timequake, Vampire State, War of Kings, World Faces Destruction, World War Hulk, World War I, World War II
name: Blockbusters of the Marvel Universe

description: Having grown tired of carrying the burden of an all-powerful telekinetic motor in his brain, Frank Fletcher tries desperately to leave his life as Motorhead behind in an effort to lead a normal existence -- but tough-guy Mace Blitzkrieg's not letting Frank have a moment's rest!
name: Power Play

description:
An Emotion Potion

Have A Happy

The Good Samaritan

Guest Work
name: An Emotion Potion

description:
Hearty Party 
Crossword Puzzlement 
Boot Route 
Letter Perfect 
The Snow Fool 
The Magic Formula
name: Hearty Party

description:
Measure Up 
Cup Cakes 
Repent Lament 
Gift of Gab 
Deep Thinking 
Mort, The Worry Wart 
Compulsion
name: Measure Up

description:
After a suffering a summer storm, a lone traveler arrives with his boat to a lost island that doesn't appear in the maps. In the island there is only a small inn runned by a woman and her son, a lighthouse that doesn't work and a pier with a wall full of messages written by travelers. Later he meets an evasive young woman who is also passing through the island, waiting for someone...
 
The island is an allegory of incommunication and the loneliness it causes.
name: Streak of Chalk

description:
In this book, Prado paints a number of fleeting relationships between people of power and/or ambition. The sex may be hot, but the feeelings are coldly subjected to careers and social climbing with poignant sometimes even dramatic results.

Tangents collects stories published in magazines: Cairo and Cimoc (both Spanish) between 1987 and 1995.
name: Tangents

description: The USG Ishimura, the most famous of the Planet-Cracker class starships, is flung from orbit around Aegis VII after the disastrous events of Dead Space. It is lost somewhere in deep space, and both the Government and a powerful religious sect called "Church of Unitology" believe it may still hold the Red Marker, an alien artifact that promises great power for either side, and both will stop at nothing to reach it first!

Just when things were beginning to go well between Ageha and Arisaka, Arisaka’s estranged mother, actress Ran Kashiwagi, shows up without any notice! When she learns about Ageha and Arisaka’s relationship, Ran uses her commanding nature to drag Ageha away on a shopping spree. However, Ran shows her softer side as she tells Ageha the story of how she fell in love with Aoi and gave birth to Arisaka. Ran realizes she’s been a terrible mother, but can Ageha help her reach out and mend her relationship with Arisaka?
name: Vol. 10

description: Ageha learns the heart-pounding and hilarious story about how Yukari and Mitsuya first met. As close as they are now, it's hard to imagine that these two friends started off as bitter rivals (but boy was Yukari extra-cute back in the day!) And when the history of Mitsuya and Tsuyu's long relationship is finally revealed, will it lead to reconciliation or a final parting of ways?
name: Vol. 11

description:
Your Second Chance to Jump In!

The first chapter of Artifacts concluded with a shocking cliffhanger and the second chapter shows no sign of letting up! With all of the players on the board, the antagonist manipulating the Bearers of the Artifacts moves to complete his plan for utter annihilation of the world. But how do the members of Cyberforce fit into the machinations of the supernatural?
name: "Artifacts" part 5 of 13; "Origin: Ember Stone"

description: Dracula 21 Page Story - The first authorized comics adaption the 1958 Hammer Film (called Horror Of Dracula in the United States) by Paul Neary. 5 Page All New Captain Kronos Vampire Hunter story in comic form. 3 Page Van Helsing's Terror Tales story entitled Voodoo Vengeance with art by Angus McKie. A 4 Page Christopher Lee Biography and a 2 Page Christopher lee Filmography.
name: The House of Hammer

description: In an epic battle, King Phelios defeats King Dusel, but both monarchs are mortally wounded. As the two lay dying, Dusel prophesies that they will meet again, sometime in another place and another time, and vows that he will be triumphant. The moment of resurrection happens hundreds of years later when Dusel comes back as a menacing baby wildcat who is rescued from the wild and adopted by Ishtar, the great-granddaughter of his nemesis, King Phelios. Ishtar is a playful girl with an iron will and a penchant for pranks, a trait that distresses her caretaker, Sir Keld, and a dashing imperial guard, Captain Dales. Ishtar is not, however, the reincarnation of Phelios, leaving the now-feline Dusel to continue his quest for revenge--without letting his new owner know that he is hell-bent on destroying her family...but would Ishtar even care about that if she knew?
name: Vol. 1

description: Ishtar is a young and saucy princess of the Phelios dynasty, in line to be Queen, and the granddaughter of the renowned King Phelios, who once defeated the Vampire King Dusel. However, Dusel, now reincarnated as Ishtar's pet wildcat, vows to avenge his previous slaughter at the hands of Phelios. But he has to find whom Phelios has been reincarnated as, something he can assess only by tasting his blood. Ishtar is more than willing to help, especially if it means seeing her cousins fight. She goes to her aunt Ramia and offers to marry whichever cousin comes out victorious in a colossal - and particularly bloody--battle of might. But Ishtar's protector, Dales, enters the fight as well, intent on ensuring that none of the cousins emerge victorious.
name: Vol. 2

description: While waiting for his turn during the final round of the competition, Darres receives shocking information from Yujinn. Ishtar's three cousins may not have blood ties to Phelios! If this is true, they are not eligible for Ishtar's hand in marriage, much less the throne of Pheliosta!! As the competition advances to its final match, time is running out for everyone! Duzell is frustrated by the lack of progress in his search for Phelios. What is the motivation behind Sharlen's desire to help Prince Seiris? Suddenly, on the eve of the final match, as Darres and his men fight against time to investigate the truth, Ishtar's backup, Duzell, is nowhere to be found...the future of Ishtar and the throne of Pheliosta is at stake!
name: Vol. 3

description: Political intrigue, martial arts action, humorous hijinks, and cases of cross-dressing all come to a head as Duzell's adventure in La Naan reaches its exciting conclusion. The unbeatable Seiliez has made a deal with the demonic vampire Sharlen. All he need do to collect the keys to the kingdom is defeat the Princess Ishtar in the final battle of the La Naan Martial Arts Tournament. Will her bodyguard, the dashing Sir Darres, come to her rescue? Not likely, as he has his hands full dealing with Sharlen's violent minions. And with Duzell preoccupied with getting back to nature, things aren't looking good for our fair princess. Especially since losing the match means matrimony with the bizarre Prince Seiliez.
name: Vol. 4

description: Ishtar and Duzell end up in the kingdom of Ci Xeneth - which is ruled by Lord Jened (Ishtar's uncle), an evil, murderous man with a burning desire to gain the throne of Pheliosta. When they decide to enter the nefarious Jened's castle in disguise in order to ferret out his true intentions, some serious cases of mistaken identity ensue...
name: Vol. 5

description: When the disguised Duzell and Ishtar visit the kingdom of Ci Xeneth and discover an unusual collection of love affairs, plots for war, hidden identities and the inhumane treatment of monsters, they must temporarily put aside their mission to find Phelios. In the mayhem that ensues will Duzell say 'I do' to Illsaide?
name: Vol. 6

description: Features Part 1 (9 pages) of the comic adaption of The Curse of Frankenstein (the story concludes in the next issue). Also features a 5 page Captain Kronos Vampire Hunter comic and a 3 page Van Helsing's Terror Tales comic entitled "Highway of Hell".

The war brewing in the castle of Ci Xeneth boils down to a final showdown between Ishtar, Duzell and Darres against Lord Jened and his High Sorcerer, Diaage. Ishtar is willing to risk her life to help the King of Merarim fulfill his last wish. And Darres is determined to risk everything to save Ishtar. Falan observes helplessly in horror, caught between the love for her father, and her desire for justice. Illsaide discovers the shocking truth behind his true identity, and the bond he shares with Lord Jened, Falan, and the King of Merarim. His loyalty is tested to the limit, and he must make a decision. Will he choose to defend Lord Jened, or will he follow his love for Falan and justice? Duty and devotion is tested to the breaking point, as everyone's decisions collide in an explosive, heartbreaking climax!
name: Vol. 7

description:
When the news Prince Yuujel's return reaches everyone in Zi Alda, all hell breaks lose, leaving Ishtar, Duzell and Darres are speechless. Lady Leene's resentment becomes more apparent--although married to Captian Ashely, she still carries a torch for the prince. As her fury grows, so, too, does a plot to destroy Ishtar and all those close to her!

Contents

  • Zi Alda Act 4
  • Zi Alda Act 5
  • Zi Alda Act 6
  • Zi Alda Act 7
  • Zi Alda Act 8
  • Zi Alda Act 9
  • Not Your Average Afterword
name: Vol. 8

description: Panged by guilt, Leene is unable to go through with her murderous plans. Filled with mixed feelings, she still cannot cast aside her desire to kill...or her growing affection for Ishtar! What's a Lady to do? Will she let her conscience be her guide?
name: Vol. 9

description: As Diaage tries to cultivate Leene's resentment against Ishtar, Leene's conscience kicks in, leaving Diaage to do her own little dirty work. Diaage decides to carry out her third and most dastardly plan yet-to poison Ishtar! Can Darres and Ashley foil her plans, save Ishtar and maintain Leene's reputation?
name: Vol. 10

description: For centuries, Persemhia -- a tiny border kingdom of Shem -- has faced down enemies from Koth, Argos, and Stygia. But the arrival of Red Sonja and her band of mercenaries has called down the combined might of all those opponents, under the command of the deadly General Cavvalus. To defeat Cavvalus and his mighty legions, Sonja may be forced to do the unthinkable: surrender.
name: War Season, Part 4: Dying Echoes

description: Family bickering has never been worse--Lassen, Ishtar's cousin, has always coveted Pheliosta's throne. Sharlen uses this to his advantage, creating the ultimate challenge for Darres. Meanwhile, in Ci Xeneth, Falan is researching information for Ishtar when she disappears! Danger threatens Yujinn, Darres, Ishtar and Duzell! Can they find a way for Darres to unsheathe Sidia, find Falan, and escape with their lives?
name: Vol. 11

description: Rishas, Duzell's former lover and companion, has been reincarnated as Lailis, the Queen of Lodoc. Lailis confesses that she was reincarnated to find Duzell and serve him once again. However, seeing Duzell's love for Ishtar, she is bitterly disappointed. Meanwhile, Lassen is busy, paying a visit to Darres and Yujinn, with a group of undead soldiers of Lodoc under his command.
name: Vol. 12

description: The danger and drama come to a head as Duzell and Ishtar escape from Mil Seii in the breathtaking climax of their darkest and most exciting adventure yet! Will the villainous Lassen and his evil cohorts Sharlen and Hume succeed in their quest to usurp the throne of Pheliosta from Ishtar? And what of Lailis and her former lover, Duzell? Is a romantic reunion in the cards? All the stops have been pulled out as the Mil Seii story arc concludes, and the world of Vampire Game will never be the same.
name: Vol. 13

description: The pieces are in place as the players ready themselves for their final moves in this no-limit game. At stake is the throne of Pheliosta, as well as the livelihood of our favorite princess, Ishtar. Illsaide is questioning his loyalties toward Falan! And, he's strong enough to tip the scale in favor of whomever he aligns with, but will he choose Ishtar or Lassen?
name: Vol. 14

description: At long last, the spectacular conclusion to the epic Vampire Game is here! Yujinn has been murdered by Vord's father, the King of Razenia. When this is discovered, Vord reacts violently. But how can he possible avenge his friend when his killer is his own flesh and blood?
name: Vol. 15

description:
It has been three years since the 'final battle' between a powerful Archmage and Van Von Hunter and his band of unlikely heroes decided the fate of the land of Dikay.

While they were narrowly saved from disaster, the outcome of the battle resulted in mass amnesia for the local populace. Fortunately, a neighboring land of goodness and righteousness, led by King Utmos, has annexed Dikay. Van Von Hunter, unaffected by the mass amnesia, has since been wandering the continent, looking for evil to smite. Having found virtually nothing of consequence, he has returned to his ancestral home to determine just what he should do with the rest of his life.

As luck would have it, upon arriving home, he finds out that the most terrible of ancient evils will befall Dikay, unless someone can stop it...I wonder who that someone will be?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 1? (Is This Really the Beginning?)
  • Chapter 2! (Yes, We Know We're Yelling!)
  • Chapter 3 (Wow, This Is A Really Small Subtitle)
  • Chapter 4 (I'm Really Running Low On Subtitle Ideas Now.)
  • Chapter 5 (We're Still Putting In Subtitles? Oh, Son of a...)
  • Chapter 666 (Uh, Yeah... It's Really Just Chapter 6.)
  • The Seventh Chapter (Hey, That Title Is So Catchy, We Don't Even Need A Subtitle. Sweet!)
  • Chapter 8
name: Vol. 1

description: Continuing their journey through the lands of Dikay, fighting the most horrid, totally wicked stuff ever imagined, Van Von Hunter and Sidekick encounter lots and lots of evil! Not only does everyone's favorite decaying jester Laspo return to wreak havoc, but we also meet the lovely, scantily armored Adonette, the famous Necromancer, who treats her rotting zombie hordes as family. Throw in something really scary lurking in a secret labyrinth and a surprise that will put lumps in your cookie dough, and you can bet your sweet tooth that Van Von Hunter and his sidekick are in more trouble than you can swing a sword at!
name: Vol. 2

description: The dark lord Kuulats returns to business! The Flaming Prince is staging a jailbreak! And King Utmos is on a quest to destroy evil! With all of these exclamation marks, you wouldn't think there would also be room for a tournament--starring all the greatest heroes in the land?! Of course there is! We've got 200 pages to fill in this next thrilling volume of Van Von Hunter...and our hero is about to educate everyone on how vanquishing evil stuff is *really* done. It may be the end of the world as we know it, but we all should feel fine.
name: Vol. 3

description:
Charley, a cyborg vampire who does the Vatican's dirty work, is the thrall of the local vampire playboy Johnny Rayflo. As the two of them fight crime--and each other--hilarity, violence and sacrilege ensue! But can Charley resist his own desperate cravings for blood? Find out as the devilish duo go up against a childlike vampire princess, a mysterious branch of the Unitarian Church...and each other.

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 1: The Confined Clagabalus
  • Chapter 2: Hierocles' Delusion
  • Chapter 3: Fleeting Dark Abba
name: Vol. 1

description: The plot thickens and the hijinks continue as our handsome duo put their own sexy spin on the Mile-High Club. An airplane ride yields several surprises for Rayflo and Charley, including a run-in with an actress with a dark secret and a mysterious saboteur. But as Charley begins an investigation of his own, his feelings for Rayflo seem to get in the way at every turn...
name: Vol. 2

description: After a hot and heavy reunion, Rayflo leaves Charley behind, hesitant to put his favorite vassal in the crosshairs of Barry. But Charley can't waste time longing for his absent master. Father Mailer is back on the scene, and the mysterious Vassalord continues to evade Charley's grasp! But what surprises await everyone during a romantic night at the opera?
name: Vol. 4

description: Hitomi Hoshino, a 16-year-old high schooler with an interest in mysticism, experiences strange dreams at night. A mysterious temple, a tremendous jewel, a shadowy prince - the images trouble her, and a strange incantation keeps echoing in her mind. During a simple fortune-telling one day Hitomi feels a magical pull, and in a shocking moment the dream incantation drags her from her body. She wakes up in a strange world where the Earth hangs in the sky and a headstrong prince asks her to power his god. Where is she? Why has she been transported? And will she really be able to wake the deity Escaflowne?
name: Vol. 1

description: Hitomi and Prince Van, in an attempt to learn more about Hitomi's abilities, visit the people of Ubdo with the aid of Allen Schezar--but the ancient Ubdo inhabitants are less than welcoming. After battles within and outside the land of the Holy Spring Hitomi learns more of the Energist power she's bestowed with. The party returns to Asturia, only to run into trouble with a band of Fanelian survivors. Their leader--the female warrior Shian--despises Prince Van for his failure to protect his country. An unsteady alliance must be formed as the patriots travel to Zaibach to rescue their queen...
name: Vol. 2

description: Hidden behind enemy lines within the Zaibach empire, Hitomi, Van, and Shian try to penetrate their enemy's forces. Unfortunately, Van's lack of subtlety is more dangerous than ever and it's all the small party can do to survive. Dangerous combat manifests Hitomi's powers again and the girl finds she is able to do more than she realized. Desperate, Van leads the others in a race against time to save his captive mother from the troubled and sadistic Dilandau. But when it comes to Queen Escalina, is it already too late?
name: Vol. 3

description: In the ongoing search for Queen Escalina, Hitomi, Van, and Shian are drawn into the magical Forest of Deception. Amidst haunting images of Van's mother being murdered the small group must battle two powerful Zaibach warriors--Colt and Shilha, Knights of Gold and Silver. When the two women capture Hitomi and Escaflowne, Hitomi's consciousness is thrown back to Earth! Shocked, Hitomi shakily falls back into a normal pattern of life back at home...but soon finds that she must return to Gaea. Van and Allen travel to Ubdo to perform the difficult spell of summoning, but no one can predict whether she'll return to their care or to where her Energist body lies: in the very headquarters of the Zaibach Empire itself. Success will take all of Van's ability, the strength of Hitomi's heart...and a miracle.
name: Vol. 4

description: Includes the 15 page comic adaption of Legend of 7 Golden Vampires, a Count Dracula story by Steve Moore and artist Brian Lewis. Also includes a 5 page Van Helsing's Terror Tales comic entitled "Curse of the Leopard Men".

Trouble is brewing in Asturia. As Allen continues to aid Van's and Hitomi's battle against the empire, Zaibach confronts Asturia with their peace treaty to contest Allen's actions. The violence of the warning forces Asturia to rethink the help it provides to Van...and Princess Millerna, with her deep feelings for Allen, is the first to want Van banished. Nationalities collide as royal duty and fervent love complicate the mix--will the conflict end only when one of our three heroes is sent to execution?
name: Vol. 5

description: The Duchy of Freid is targeted as the final country in Zaibach's violent conquest. As the Revolutionary Army gathers in Freid to protect the country and its child Duke, Van is forced to reign in his feelings and keep his fingers from Dilandau's throat. Meanwhile, Hitomi feels a strong calling as she crosses Freid's borders, and a consuming vision reveals some of the secret behind Escaflowne's past. It will take the power of both the Revolutionary Army and Freid itself to combat Zaibach when the inevitable battle begins. Van, Hitomi, and Dilandau must also prepare psychologically for the attack--Zaibach's strongest warriors bring more than battle prowess to the field.
name: Vol. 6

description: After the battle with Zaibach, trials in Freid have still not ended. As violence is brewing within the Revolutionary Army, Dilandau's sanity wears ever thinner. While new enemies emerge, new allies arise and the quest to save Gaea starts spiraling out of control. And in a moment of stress, Van and Hitomi bond in a way they never have before!
name: Vol. 7

description: What does it take to save a world? Van and Hitomi have come to the end of their journey, but the final showdown with Dornkirk is not going as planned! It will take their combined strength to see beyond the battle and back to the very start of Gaea. All secrets are revealed and all battles completed in this final, shocking volume of The Vision of Escaflowne.
name: Vol. 8

description: This issue features a 15 page comics adaption of the Hammer film "Dracula Prince of Darkness", written by Donne Avenell with gorgeous artwork by John Bolton. It also features a 4 page Van Helsing's Terror Tales entitled "Mavoisin's Mirror", written by Chris Lowder with art by Brian Lewis. Also included are a number of feature articles and reviews.
Features an 18 page comic adaption of Twins of Evil by Chris Lowder and artist Blas Gallego and a 1 page comic Van Helsing's History of Horrory by Dave Gibbons.

Titans clash in this first hardcover collection of SUPERMAN tales from fan-favorite writer James Robinson (STARMAN)!

Featuring SUPERMAN #677-680, this is the battle to end all others as Superman faces off with Atlas, lost god of myth. And when Atlas stakes a claim on Metropolis, it's up to Superman and Krypto to take Atlas down.

As a bonus, this collection also includes FIRST ISSUE SPECIAL #1, the 1975 tale by Jack "King" Kirby that introduced Atlas!
name: The Coming of Atlas

description:
Overview:

Before Season Eight, Joss Whedon brought generations of Slayers and vampires to comics with the help of his acclaimed TV writing team and some of the best artists to ever grace the comics page. Now all those stories, plus selected stories from Season Eight, are collected in one deluxe hardcover with a new cover by Jo Chen.

Joss writes multiple tales: a somber vamp tale, drawn by Cameron Stewart; the story of the first Slayer, drawn by Leinil Yu; and more. Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Tales also reprints for the first time new Season Eight stories written by novelist Jackie Kessler (Hell's Belles) and award-winning cartoonist Becky Cloonan (Demo), featuring vampires living in the public eye, killing Slayers and killing each other. * This hardcover collects stories from MySpace Dark Horse Presents #31 and #32; Tales of the Vampires: Carpe Noctem parts 1 and 2; Buffy: Tales of the Vampires one-shot; Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Tales of the Vampires #1--#5; Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Tales of the Slayers #1--"Broken Bottle of Djinn"; Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Tales of the Slayers TPB.

Before Season Eight . . .
name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Tales

description: Following the startling events of NEW KRYPTON, Earth finds itself without Superman. Luckily, Metropolis still has heroes like Mon-El. But after years of knowing nothing but the solitude of the Phantom Zone, how will Mon-El acclimate himself to society? And the recently returned Guardian has his hands full with his new position in the Science Police. How can they fill Superman's shoes? Collecting SUPERMAN #684-690, ACTION COMICS #874 and elements from ACTION COMICS ANNUAL #10!
name: Vol. 1

description:
Everyone Hyo-Bin has ever been close to has been brutally murdered! Her horrifying reality is seeping into her nightmares, where classmates from her new school mysteriously appear. Not only does Hyo-Bin have to deal with budding friendships and potential love interests, she seems to have a supernatural ability she can't quite understand--or control! Is this power connected to her dreams? What has really happened to Hyo-Bin's late friends? Are her new school friends in danger of suffering the same fate?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 1: Don't Come Closer
  • Chapter 2: The Kid I Met In My Dream
  • Chapter 3: My Friend's Room
  • Chapter 4: Secrets and Lies
  • Chapter 5: Clue
  • Chapter 6: She
name: Vol. 1

description:
The class tries to get the resident palm-reading expert to read the fortunes of Hyo-Bin and Mi-Soo. However, when he reads Hyo-Bin's hand, he is forced to let it go in fear, leaving the class wondering what happened. He quickly diverts the attention by reading Mi-Soo's hand...but the result is frightening as well. Will the class be able to coerce him into telling them just what he saw?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 7: Warning
  • Chapter 8: Secret Revealed
  • Chapter 9: I Will Protect You
  • Chapter 10: Dangerous
  • Chapter 11: Behind
  • Chapter 12: Mystery
name: Vol. 2

description:
As Hyo-Bin tries to get more answers from Tae-Ryun about her past, she discovers that she might have a sister. But just when she's about to learn more information about this mysterious sibling, a jealous Ji-Hwan interrupts the session and beats up Tae-Ryun. And when Ji-Hwan's girlfriend arrives on the scene, will resentment and accusations lead to even more trouble?

Chapter Titles

  • Evidence
  • Jealousy
  • Secret
  • Wandering Spirit
  • Contact
  • That Man

* none of the chapters in this volume were numbered.
name: Vol. 3

description:
The classic shojo horror-fest continues! Hyo-Bin visits Min-Soo, who tells her some surprising news about Hyo-Ri. As a result, Hyo-Bin must face the dark secrets hidden in her past!

Chapter Titles

  • Meeting
  • Mosaic
  • Difficult Memory
  • Game
  • It's Because of Him!
  • Girl

* none of the chapters in this volume were numbered.
name: Vol. 4

description:
All her life, Hyo-Bin has been haunted by nightmares and sinister dreams, and she's about to find out why. Having only recently learned of her sister's existence, she's now about to be drawn into her life in a way she never could have imagined. But why was her sister hidden from her in the first place? What dark secret is Min-Soo hiding? Are the sinister events of Hyo-Ri's last night on earth destined to repeat themselves? It's the final volume of Visitor, and the truth about Hyo-Bin is about to be revealed!

Chapter Titles

  • Pieces of Memory
  • Father's Memory
  • Feelings That Crossed Paths
  • Visitor
  • Confusion
  • Grudge

* none of the chapters in this volume were numbered.
name: Vol. 5

description: With The Man of Steel away on New Krypton, it's up to Mon-El to face off against Bizarro and General Lane in this new hardcover collecting SUPERMAN #692-697, SUPERMAN ANNUAL #14, SUPERMAN SECRET FILES 2009 #1 and ADVENTURE COMICS #11. Plus, Mon-El debuts his new Superman–inspired costume in this collection guest-starring Superboy, The Legion of Super-Heroes and others. And when Superman returns to Earth, will Mon-El give up his duty as protector of a city he's grown to love?
name: Vol. 2: Man of Valor

description: This issue basically retells the beginning of the Legend Reborn movie - Mata Nui arrives at Bata Magna and is forced to fight Strakk. Joining forces with Ackar and Kiina, he starts searching for the way home.
name: Before the Storm

description:
Story Titles 

  • Angel El Indeseable Capitulo Cuarto Y Final 
  • Educacion Sexual 
  • Odio: En Busca Del Enigmatico George Hamilton III 
  • El Dia De La Bestia Capitulo Tres 
  • R'N'R La Boda 
  • Vortex Capitulo Cuatro 
  • Not Quite Dead 
  • El Demonio Rojo 
  • Botas Y Tacos: Me Subi A La Verja 
  • Konrad Y Paul: Bon Apettit 
  • Miyuki Mata Capitulo Uno 
  • Tank Girl, La Odisea Capitulo Tres

Story Titles 

  • Tank Girl, La Odisea Cap. 4 
  • Rubber Flesh 
  • Odio, La Vieja Llama 
  • Daniel Calparsoro 
  • El Dia De La Bestia 
  • R'N'R, Dinero 
  • El Fracaso Matrimonial 
  • El Ojo Del Vigilante 
  • Vortex, Campbell Cap. 1 
  • Sprayliz 
  • La Transicion 
  • Botas Y Tacos, Bonito Soborno 
  • Reencarnacion 
  • Miyuki Mata Cap 2. 
  • Ola De Calor 
  • Teeny Tunes 
  • El Demonio Rojo 
  • Not Quite Dead 
  • La Isla 
  • Planeta Enfermo

Story Titles 

  • Rubber Flesh, Ine Overload Unit 
  • El Fracaso Matrimonial 
  • Primeras Palabras 
  • Miyuki Mata, Cap 3 
  • Psiquico 
  • Not Quite Dead 
  • R'N'R, La Maketa 
  • Tank Girl, La Odisea Cap. 5

Buckle down your mortarboards, students of Marvel's merry mutants, 'cause we've got a summer crash course in X-Men classics coming your way! Lesson #1: It ain't easy being an X-Man. No sooner has their mentor, Professor X, died than who shows up but Magneto and the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants! Only a study in teamwork with Earth's Mightiest Heroes can help our grieving heroes make the grade! Lesson #2: Think twice before inviting family over. A friendly house call from the Juggernaut or Polaris, the daughter of Magneto himself, isn't the summertime bliss the brochure may have described! Lesson #3: Battling a bevy of baddies including Mesmero, Blastaar, the Red Raven, Warlock and Computo may cause cramps. Be sure to stretch before jumping into this pool! And for extra credit you can pull an all-nighter with the origins of Iceman and Beast, along with a rare solo story featuring the Angel! Consult guest instructors Jim Steranko, Barry Smith and John Buscema this July or risk failure at the end of the term. Dismissed!

Reprints X-Men #43-53, Avengers #53, and selections from Ka-Zar #2-3 and Marvel Tales #30.

Including guest appearances by the Avengers, Ka-Zar and others!

description:
Official Solicitation: Loosely Translated From The Original French 

When a girl tries to learn the secrets to an adult's happiness.  Dreamlike and poetic tale carried by a drawing remarquable.Yulkukany the island to whalers.  A piece of land lost by the spray, mostly occupied by a wild and grand, and punctuated by scattered huts inhabited by indigenous taciturn and suspicious.  For many sailors the sea has not returned to their homes ... Milander Dean, geologist, arrived in Yulkukany in research mission.  But Dean seeks first and foremost a haven of tranquility to pass the time. Alone.  A horribly long time now since the loss of loved ones.  One time he was finally what to do ... Elianor, a native of the island, is contrary to the joy of living flesh.  A dreamy girl, sensitive, adorable as all, with a lively imagination and boundless good humor contagious.  If only for Dean's good humor is just a disease.  And he did not intend to let contaminate ... Halfway stories maritime Stevenson flights of fantasy and animist Miyazaki, Enrique Fernandez built a face-to-face meeting between a beautiful and disconcerting adult income and a girl of any trust in life intact.  Pledged a graphic of all beauty, the island without a smile is a sensitive and enchanting tale that doubles as an amazing and beautiful reflection on happiness and the art of keeping warm in his heart.  A work known to date.

Supergirl and Flamebird must work together to track down their father's assassin – Reactron! But these childhood friends find themselves at each other's throats in these stories from SUPERGIRL #43 and 45-47, ACTION COMICS #881-882 and SUPERMAN SECRET FILES 2009 #1.
name: Volume 7

description: Collecting three titanic tales from SUPERMAN/BATMAN #50-56! First up, it's the untold story of how Superman's dad and Batman's father had a fateful meeting many years ago! Then, the Li'I League is on the scene as miniature versions of the JLA find their way into the DCU! It's up to Superman, Batman and their peers to keep the tykes from destroying everything in their path. And in the third story, The Man of Steel's powers find a new home in the body of The Dark Knight. Now Batman possesses incredible Kryptonian abilities while Superman stands powerless. How will they adjust physically and psychologically to these bizarre changes? And will Batman's new absolute powers corrupt him absolutely?
name: Finest Worlds

description: Features a 15 page comic adaption of "Curse of the Werewolf" by writer Steve Grant and artist John Bolton.
This issue contains the comic adaptation of the film One Million Years BC.
